intro: Coutarea corymbosa, commonly known as the red sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a distinctive red, aromatic resin that has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a source of valuable timber. Its botanical features include yellowish-white flowers and a woody, branching structure. The species is also noted for its ecological importance in its native habitats.
